Use case name: Referral intake + doc capture + routing
Summary: Trigger: inbound fax/email/portal → classify docs (face sheet, H&P;, discharge summary) → create/attach resident pre-admit record → route to admissions nurse, therapy, business office. (approach: OCR+classification [S25][S26][S28] + workflow engine [S29][S31] + integration; RPA for portals.). Expected outcomes: Fewer rekeys; faster acceptance/declines; fewer missing docs that later drive claim errors [S7][S9].
Dependencies: Integrations (APIs/HL7/FHIR/EDI/portals); Document ingestion/OCR; Workflow engine & workqueues
Risks & compliance notes: Misclassification; duplicate residents; exception volume spikes.
Evidence: p4 — Admissions / Intake / Eligibility / Bed Mgmt table

Use case name: Real-time eligibility & benefits verification (EDI 270/271) + insurance card OCR
Summary: Trigger: referral / change-of-coverage → run 270/271 → parse response → update payor fields; capture card images; alert for auth requirements. (approach: Integration (EDI) + rules; OCR for cards; RPA if payer portal only.). Expected outcomes: Fewer coverage surprises; faster auth initiation; reduced downstream denials due to coverage miskeys.
Dependencies: Integrations (APIs/HL7/FHIR/EDI/portals); Document ingestion/OCR; Rules/policy logic; Change management
Risks & compliance notes: Payer variability; response parsing errors; staff overriding.
Evidence: p4 — Admissions / Intake / Eligibility / Bed Mgmt table

Use case name: Voice dictation / STT for nurses/therapy with guardrails

Expected outcomes: Potential time savings; but only if paired with verification and retention; measurable improvements reported in ambient scribe studies (non-SNF) [S14].
Risks & compliance notes: Hallucinations/false insertions [S16]; PHI leakage; deletion of audio removes auditability.

Use case name: Inbound physician orders (fax) auto-ingest → order entry queue

Summary: Continuously collect artifacts → map to F-tags → maintain versioned policies/attestations → rapid export for survey. (approach: Workflow + document mgmt + OCR; rules for retention; RAG over policies (AI only for search/summary).). Expected outcomes: Lower survey prep burden; faster response; fewer missing-document citations (qualitative; driven by survey document requests) [S6].
Dependencies: Integrations (APIs/HL7/FHIR/EDI/portals); Document ingestion/OCR; Workflow engine & workqueues; Rules/policy logic
Risks & compliance notes: Over-reliance on auto-tagging; outdated policies; access control for sensitive docs.

Use case name: MDS support + QRP submission validation and exception handling
Summary: Pre-submission validation → missing item alerts → auto-create tasks for disciplines → submit, monitor rejects, resubmit. (approach: Integration + rules engine; workflow; analytics.). Expected outcomes: Fewer rejected submissions; avoid QRP penalties (APU reduction risk) [S11].
Dependencies: Integrations (APIs/HL7/FHIR/EDI/portals); Workflow engine & workqueues; Rules/policy logic; Analytics/process mining
Risks & compliance notes: Rule drift across manual updates; data source ambiguity; role clarity.

Use case name: IT access provisioning & quarterly access reviews across facilities
Summary: HR hire/term event → create accounts → assign roles → MFA → log actions; periodic access recertification; privileged access workflow. (approach: Integration (SCIM/SSO) + workflow; RPA for legacy; policy engine (OPA).). Expected outcomes: Faster onboarding/ offboarding; reduced orphaned accounts; better auditability [S1].
Dependencies: Integrations (APIs/HL7/FHIR/EDI/portals); Workflow engine & workqueues; Rules/policy logic
Risks & compliance notes: Role design issues; least privilege hard; shadow IT.

Use case name: Procurement par-levels + auto-reorder + lot/expiry traceability
Summary: Consumption/receiving triggers → reorder rules → reconcile invoices; lot/expiry capture at receiving; alerts. (approach: Integration; barcode/mobile; rules engine.). Expected outcomes: Less nursing 'hunt time'; lower waste; fewer missed charges (if supplies billable).
Risks & compliance notes: Data capture burden; vendor item master inconsistency; scanning compliance.

Use case name: Document understanding: classify/route inbound faxes and mail (orders, denials, ADRs)
Summary: Rules struggle because document formats vary and include free text; AI improves classif ication/extraction beyond template OCR. Minimal data: Labeled set of ~500–2,000 docs per class; ground-truth routing outcome; continuous drift monitoring.. Stack: OCR (Tesseract/Paddl eOCR) [S25][S26] + layout (LayoutParser) [S27] + extraction via LLM (Llama/Mistral) served with vLLM/TGI [S17][S18] + guardrails (Presidio) [S20].. Evaluation: Test: per-class precision/recall; extraction field-level F1; “silent failure” rate; PHI leakage tests.
Risks & compliance notes: Model drift; over-extraction; missing rare doc types; staff bypass.
Evidence: p12 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table

Use case name: NLP for denial reason classification and appeal drafting assist
Summary: Denial letters are unstructured and payer-specific; rules are brittle; AI can map narrative to CARC/RARC/next actions. Minimal data: Corpus of denials + final resolution; mapping to standard categories; appeal outcomes.. Stack: RAG over payer policies/contract terms + embeddings (BGE) [S24] + vector DB (pgv ector/Qdrant/Milvus) [S21][S22][S23] + reranker (FlagEmbedding) [S24].. Evaluation: Evaluate: correct category rate; appeal packet completeness; human rating; monitor hallucinations.
Risks & compliance notes: Hallucinated policy citations; confidential contract leakage; biased suggestions.
Evidence: p12 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table

Use case name: Survey/deficienc y evidence extraction and crosswalk to F-tags
Summary: Survey requests are ad hoc; evidence lives across systems; AI can semantically find relevant logs/notes quickly. Minimal data: Indexed corpus of policies, logs, training, audits; tag mapping to F-tags (Appendix PP) [S6].. Stack: RAG over evidence locker; vector DB; strict retrieval-only answers; audit logs and citations.. Evaluation: Evaluate: retrieval recall on known evidence sets; citation correctness; abstention rate.
Evidence: p12 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table

Use case name: Policy/SOP 'how do I' copilot for staff (internal only)
Summary: Staff questions are long-tail; hard to keep consistent answers; AI can guide but must cite policy sources. Minimal data: Clean, versioned policies + Q&A; logs; access control tags.. Stack: RAG + open-source LLM; serving via vLLM/TGI [S17][S18]; policy engine for access (OPA) [S35].. Evaluation: Evaluate: answer groundedness; refusal on missing source; PHI redaction effectiveness (Presidio) [S20].
Risks & compliance notes: Hallucinations; policy conflicts; accidental PHI disclosure.
Evidence: p12 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table

Use case name: Ambient documentation / STT to draft notes (human attestation required)
Summary: Typing burden; but transcription errors /hallucinations can be clinically risky [S16]. Minimal data: Audio capture policy + consent; note templates; clinician review workflows; retention rules.. Stack: Open-source Whisper [S10] with on-prem/VPC deployment + confidence gating; optional commercial ambient solutions with BAAs.. Evaluation: Evaluate: word error rate on local accents; hallucination incidence; time-in-note changes (evidence in ambient studies) [S14].
Risks & compliance notes: False content insertion [S16]; privacy of always-on mics; consent and auditability.
Evidence: p12 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table

Use case name: Predictive analytics: overtime risk / call-out risk
Summary: Rules can flag thresholds; prediction adds value when patterns across sites are complex. Minimal data: 12–24 months of scheduling, payroll, census/acuity; labeled overtime outcomes.. Stack: Classical ML (XGBoost) + feature store (Feast) + MLOps; keep explainable.. Evaluation: Evaluate: calibration; lift vs baseline rules; fairness across job classes.
Risks & compliance notes: Bad labels; per-facility drift; gaming of metrics.
Evidence: p12 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table

Use case name: Predictive analytics: turnover risk
Summary: Can prioritize retention interventions; must avoid discriminatory use. Minimal data: HRIS history, tenure, schedule volatility, training, manager changes; outcome: voluntary term.. Stack: Explainable ML; privacy review; avoid protected attributes.. Evaluation: Evaluate: AUC + precision at top-k; disparate impact checks; intervention ROI.
Risks & compliance notes: Bias; chilling effects; misuse as punitive tool.
Evidence: p13 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table

Use case name: Clinical risk prediction: falls/r eadmissions (only if data supports)
Summary: Only useful if it drives actionable interventions; must avoid alert fatigue. Minimal data: MDS, vitals, incident reports, therapy notes; outcomes with time stamps.. Stack: Classical ML + rules layering; keep interpretable; integrate into workflows.. Evaluation: Evaluate: sensitivity at fixed false-positive rate; prospective silent trial; safety monitoring.
Evidence: p13 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table

Use case name: Computer vision / sensors: fall detection & safety rounds
Summary: Adds value when humans can’t observe continuously; requires consent & clear purpose. Minimal data: Video/sensor data; privacy impact assessment; secure storage.. Stack: Edge inference; anonymization; consider not storing raw video when possible; policy + signage.. Evaluation: Evaluate: false alarms per day; missed event rate; response time improvement.
Risks & compliance notes: Consent, resident dignity, surveillance creep; cybersecurity.
Evidence: p13 — Part 2 AI as an Accelerator table
